DOC.HEAD: Police Say Woman Faked Kidnapping of Her Two Toddlers
DOC.TEXT: A woman faked a kidnapping of her two children in a scheme to get $12,000 ``ransom'' from her husband and then leave him, police said. Arazelia Delgadillo, 27, was freed Monday on $200 bail on charges of falsifying a police report, which carries up to six months in jail and a $1,000 fine. Ms. Delgadillo on Saturday told police her 2-year-old and 4-year-old boys had been taken along with her car while she was inside a grocery store. Police, following instructions from Ms. Delgadillo, set up a ransom drop Sunday, but the ``kidnappers'' never showed, authorities said. Later Sunday, FBI agents traced a phone call made to the woman's home and found the children at an apartment where Ms. Delgadillo's 14-year-old brother was living, police said. ``She thought her husband would just go to the bank, get $12,000, and she would take it and leave,'' Sgt. Mark Langford said. No charges were filed against the woman's brother.
